properties.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western/Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Teller County/Rampart Range above 7500fT/Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Colorado Springs Vicinity/Southern El Paso County/Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County  Above 8500Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern El Paso County/Monument Ridge/Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Canon City Vicinity/Eastern Fremont County; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 1:40PM MST until February 4 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo CO
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches
across the higher terrain, with 2 to 6 inches across the lower
elevations. Winds gusting around 45 mph at times over the
mountains and around 25 mph at times over the lower elevations.

* WHERE...Teller, Fremont and El Paso counties, The northern
Sangre de Cristo and Wet mountains as well as the Wet Mountain
Valley.

* WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult with icy and snow packed
roads. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening
commute on Monday and morning commute on Tuesday. The cold
wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in
hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY
